There are tons of lists out there telling you what gadgets and accessories you should have in your kitchen.
Curious to see what a professional would recommend, though, we asked Brad Farmerie , the Michelin-star chef behind PUBLIC , Saxon + Parole , and the GENUINE franchise, about his kitchen must-haves.
Whether you know your way around a kitchen or are a complete cooking novice, you're bound to get a lot of use out of Farmerie's recommendations.
View As: One Page Slides A digital scale Amazon "The newest digital scales are inexpensive and measure in both American measurements as well as metric, preferably by the gram," Farmerie told Business Insider.
"I can hand a recipe off to any cook, and if they use the scale, they will be half way to success!"
Coleman-Hall Digital Scale, $14.95
A coffee and spice grinder Amazon "Grinding your own whole spices leads to bigger, brighter, better flavors, and allows you to stay away from extra salt," Farmerie told us.
Cuisinart DCG-12BC Grind Central Coffee Grinder, $25.95 An ice cube tray Amazon "I use these at home to freeze chicken stock into cubes, then pop them out into plastic bags and keep frozen until needed," the chef said.
"The same can be done with other things, like coconut milk or fresh herbs — cilantro, parsley, mint all work well. Puree the herbs in a blender with just a little olive oil and freeze them into cubes."
Practico Kitchen Superb Cube 1.4 Inch Cube Silicone Ice Cube Tray, $14.99 A frying pan Amazon "These are what I use at the restaurant," Farmerie said. "If you season them properly and take care of them, they will literally last a lifetime. I have a few that are 15 years-old and look (and cook!) like new. The reason I like them is like cast iron, they get a natural non-stick surface so you don’t need to use much oil when cooking. But unlike cast iron, they are lightweight."
Eurodib de Buyer Fry Pan, $59.99 Olive oil Amazon "We use this oil at all of our restaurants and at my house as well," Farmerie , who is an ambassador for California Olive Ranch, said.
"They have a great range from everyday oils to finishing oils packed with personality, and their products have recently become available all around America. Don’t save it for special occasions or salad dressings — cook with it, deep fry in it, drizzle it over a finished dish, or even put a few drops in your dirty martini."
California Olive Ranch Everyday Extra Virgin Olive Oil, from $17.20 A wine system Amazon "This is the budget buster, but truly worth it if you drink good wine or have a bunch of nice bottles on your shelf waiting for an occasion big enough to go through 750ml of deliciousness," he said.
"Wait no longer. The Coravin system allows you to pour yourself a glass without pulling the cork, and then tops the bottle with a gas that allows the remaining wine to not deteriorate over time. Magic? Perhaps, and a magic worth breaking the budget. "
Coravin Model Two Plus Pack, $349.95 A knife sheath Amazon "If you’ve taken the time and spent the money on a nice knife, go the extra distance and get a nice wooden knife cover to preserve the blade and keep it sharp," Farmerie recommended.
"If you haven’t taken the time or spent the money to get a nice knife, you have other problems to think about and will need to bust your budget a bit to rectify the situation."
